abstract: Brazil’s Institute for Water Management in Minas Gerais reports illegal levels of arsenic and mercury in Rio Doce after dam burst at nearby iron ore mine; findings contradict claims by mine operator Samarco and its co-owners BHP Billiton and Vale that waste released into river was not toxic.
lead_paragraph: Illegal levels of arsenic and mercury polluted a river in the days after a dam burst at an iron ore mine this month.

headline.main: Brazil: River Polluted After Dam Burst
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Brazil: River Polluted After Dam Burst

snippet: Illegal levels of arsenic and mercury polluted a river in the days after a dam burst at an iron ore mine this month.
